intro: Pleurostachys paranensis var. ypirangensis, commonly known as the Ypiranga palm, is a rare and endemic species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a small, evergreen palm characterized by its slender trunk and pinnate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of silky white hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers followed by orange-red fruits containing edible seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the humid climate of its native region. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
